cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat OpenShift Jaeger 1.17.3 container images security update
cvrfdoc.document_distribution: Copyright Â© 2021 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

full_product_name.product_name: jaeger-all-in-one-rhel7-container-1.17.3-2 as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Jaeger 1.17
jaeger-collector-rhel7-container-1.17.3-2 as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Jaeger 1.17
jaeger-ingester-rhel7-container-1.17.3-2 as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Jaeger 1.17

notes.note: jaegertracing/jaeger: credentials leaked to container logs

reference.description: bz#1838401: CVE-2020-10750 jaegertracing/jaeger: credentials leaked to container logs

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.4/jaeger/jaeger_install/rhbjaeger-updating.html

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank Carl Henrik Lunde (SpareBank 1) for reporting this issue.

note:
An update for jaeger-all-in-one-rhel7-container, jaeger-collector-rhel7-container, and jaeger-ingester-rhel7-container is now available for Jaeger-1.17.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

Red Hat OpenShift Jaeger is Red Hat's distribution of the Jaeger project,
tailored for installation into an on-premise OpenShift Container Platform
installation.
Security Fix(es):
* jaegertracing/jaeger: credentials leaked to container logs (CVE-2020-10750)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
